title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 7: Keeping your registration alive
Agents and attorneys: Learn to think like a patent examiner with STEPP's four-day course
description: If you are a United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) registered patent attorney or agent, it helps to think like a USPTO patent examiner. Get a better understanding of how examiners make decisions by attending the Stakeholder Training on Examination Practice and Procedure (STEPP) agent-attorney four-day course, November 14-17, 2023.

title: SOaR webinar: Hague applications for international design protection
description: Are you interested in protecting your design in multiple countries? If so, please join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) on Tuesday, November 14, from 3-4:30 p.m. ET, for a free virtual webinar on the benefits of filing Hague applications for international design protection.

title: A fireside chat with USPTO patent examiners
description: Come join us for a laid back and informational fireside chat that will give you an inside look at being a patent examiner at the USPTO. You will get the opportunity to engage in insightful conversations and get answers to your questions directly from team members.

title: China IP: Quarterly legislation and case law update

Fireside Chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims
description: Join the next Patent Trial and Appeal Board Boardside Chat webinar on Thursday, November 16, from noon to 1 p.m. ET, for a fireside chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims. Judge Holte will discuss the jurisdiction and types of cases handled by the Court of Federal Claims, procedures used in those cases, and best practices when appearing before the court.

title: The Path to a Patent, Part VI: Learn how to protect your IP abroad
One-day patents boot camp
description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day patents boot camp on November 16 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET at Gateway Area Development District in Morehead, Kentucky. This in-person, single-day workshop is for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and inventors in communities with limited or no internet access, covering tools, techniques, and resources to understand the patent application process.

title: Learn about recent updates to internal decision circulation and review procedures at the PTAB
description: On October 6, 2023, the USPTO issued a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) on PTAB’s pre-issuance internal decision circulation and review. The PTAB also issued a new Standing Operating Procedure on pre-issuance and post-issuance decision review, and updated and renumbered its SOP on handling remands from the Federal Circuit. Join the next PTAB Boardside Chat webinar on Thursday, November 16, from noon to 1 p.m. ET, for a discussion about the NPRM and the SOPs with PTAB’s Vice Chief Judge Melissa Haapala.

title: One-day trademarks boot camp
description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day trademarks boot camp on November 18, 2023 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. CT with Build Bronzeville SBDC at Quad Communities Development Corporation (QCDC) in Chicago, Illinois. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and start-ups in communities with limited or no internet access, covering what they should know about trademarks.

title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 8: Question-and-answer panel
Empowering Innovations: Celebrating Hispanic pioneers in education and invention-RESCHEDULED
description: This event has been rescheduled. Please refer to this listing for updates and information.

title: K-12 education office hours
Patent Public Advisory Committee public meeting
description: Attend the next public meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) to learn more about patent-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. You can watch the virtual public session via WebEx. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

title: The Path to a Patent, Part VII: How to file a patent application using Patent Center
Roundtable discussion: Tribes, intellectual property, and consumer protection
Intellectual Property Basics and Helpful Resources
The Path to a Patent, Part VIII: Common mistakes and post-filing support
A day in the life of a USPTO patent examiner
description: Do you want a challenging career? Would you like the opportunity to work from home nationwide with a ﬂexible schedule? Do you want to be a part of a culture of inclusivity and camaraderie, and a community that leads America toward breakthroughs in innovation? Are you a U.S. citizen graduating this year with a focus in any of these fields?	Biology	Biomedical Engineering	Chemistry	Chemical Engineering	Computer Engineering	Computer Science	Design	Electrical Engineering	Mechanical Engineering	Physics 	If you answered yes to any of these questions, you may belong at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) as a patent examiner! We recruit the most promising at America’s Innovation Agency, and we encourage you to take the step forward in your journey today by joining us on December 11 at noon ET for an informational webinar on becoming a patent examiner.
